trans-unit.source: Manage device settings with policies | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Manage device settings with policies | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use Intune to create and deploy policies that control settings and features on enrolled devices that you manage.
trans-unit.target: Use Intune to create and deploy policies that control settings and features on enrolled devices that you manage.

trans-unit.source: Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies
trans-unit.target: Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Intune *policies* are groups of settings that control features on mobile devices and computers.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Intune *policies* are groups of settings that control features on mobile devices and computers.

trans-unit.source: You create policies by using templates that contain recommended or custom settings, and then you deploy them to device or user groups.
trans-unit.target: You create policies by using templates that contain recommended or custom settings, and then you deploy them to device or user groups.

trans-unit.source: Types of policies
trans-unit.target: Types of policies

trans-unit.source: Intune policies fall into the following categories.
trans-unit.target: Intune policies fall into the following categories.

trans-unit.source: The category that you use affects how you create and deploy the policy.
trans-unit.target: The category that you use affects how you create and deploy the policy.

trans-unit.source: **Configuration policies**: These are commonly used to manage security settings and features on your devices.
trans-unit.target: **Configuration policies**: These are commonly used to manage security settings and features on your devices.

trans-unit.source: Use the information in this topic to learn about how to create and deploy these policies and to explore the available settings.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in this topic to learn about how to create and deploy these policies and to explore the available settings.

trans-unit.source: **Device compliance policies**: These define the rules and settings that a device must comply with in order to be considered compliant by conditional access polices.
trans-unit.target: **Device compliance policies**: These define the rules and settings that a device must comply with in order to be considered compliant by conditional access polices.

trans-unit.source: You can also use compliance policies to monitor and remediate the compliance of devices independent of conditional access.
trans-unit.target: You can also use compliance policies to monitor and remediate the compliance of devices independent of conditional access.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Device compliance policies in Microsoft Intune](introduction-to-device-compliance-policies-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Device compliance policies in Microsoft Intune](introduction-to-device-compliance-policies-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: **Conditional access polices**: These policies help you secure email and other services, depending on conditions that you specify.
trans-unit.target: **Conditional access polices**: These policies help you secure email and other services, depending on conditions that you specify.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Restrict access to email and O365 services with Microsoft Intune](restrict-access-to-email-and-o365-services-with-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Restrict access to email and O365 services with Microsoft Intune](restrict-access-to-email-and-o365-services-with-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: **Corporate device enrollment policies**: For information about corporate device enrollment policies, see [Set up iOS and Mac management with Microsoft Intune](set-up-ios-and-mac-management-with-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: **Corporate device enrollment policies**: For information about corporate device enrollment policies, see [Set up iOS and Mac management with Microsoft Intune](set-up-ios-and-mac-management-with-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: **Resource access policies**: These policies work together to help your users gain access to the files and resources that they need to do their work successfully, wherever they are.
trans-unit.target: **Resource access policies**: These policies work together to help your users gain access to the files and resources that they need to do their work successfully, wherever they are.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Enable access to company resources with Microsoft Intune](enable-access-to-company-resources-with-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Enable access to company resources with Microsoft Intune](enable-access-to-company-resources-with-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: For a complete list of Intune policies, see [Microsoft Intune policy reference](microsoft-intune-policy-reference.md).
trans-unit.target: For a complete list of Intune policies, see [Microsoft Intune policy reference](microsoft-intune-policy-reference.md).

trans-unit.source: Create a configuration policy
trans-unit.target: Create a configuration policy

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/), choose **Policy** > **Configuration Policies** > **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/), choose **Policy** > **Configuration Policies** > **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Choose the policy that you want, choose to use the recommended settings for the policy (if available; you can change these settings later), or choose to create a custom policy with your own settings.
trans-unit.target: Choose the policy that you want, choose to use the recommended settings for the policy (if available; you can change these settings later), or choose to create a custom policy with your own settings.

trans-unit.source: For help choosing the right policy, see the [Microsoft Intune policy reference](microsoft-intune-policy-reference.md).
trans-unit.target: For help choosing the right policy, see the [Microsoft Intune policy reference](microsoft-intune-policy-reference.md).

trans-unit.source: When you are ready, choose **Create Policy**.
trans-unit.target: When you are ready, choose **Create Policy**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Create Policy** page, configure a name and optional description for the policy.
trans-unit.target: On the **Create Policy** page, configure a name and optional description for the policy.

trans-unit.source: Configure the required policy settings, and then choose **Save Policy**.
trans-unit.target: Configure the required policy settings, and then choose **Save Policy**.

trans-unit.source: If you need help with any policy settings, choose your policy type from the following list:
trans-unit.target: If you need help with any policy settings, choose your policy type from the following list:

trans-unit.source: [Settings for iOS devices](ios-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Settings for iOS devices](ios-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: [Settings for Android devices](android-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Settings for Android devices](android-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: [Settings for Windows 8 and Windows 8.1 devices](windows-configuration-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Settings for Windows 8 and Windows 8.1 devices](windows-configuration-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: [Settings for Windows Phone 8.1 devices](windows-phone-8-1-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Settings for Windows Phone 8.1 devices](windows-phone-8-1-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: [Settings for Windows 10 desktop and mobile devices](windows-10-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Settings for Windows 10 desktop and mobile devices](windows-10-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: [Settings for Windows Team devices](windows-team-configuration-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Settings for Windows Team devices](windows-team-configuration-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: [Settings for Windows edition upgrade](edition-upgrade-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Settings for Windows edition upgrade](edition-upgrade-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: [Settings for Mac OS X devices](mac-os-x-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Settings for Mac OS X devices](mac-os-x-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: [Settings for Exchange ActiveSync](exchange-activesync-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Settings for Exchange ActiveSync](exchange-activesync-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: [Settings for the terms and conditions policy](terms-and-condition-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Settings for the terms and conditions policy](terms-and-condition-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: [General settings for mobile devices (legacy)](mobile-device-security-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [General settings for mobile devices (legacy)](mobile-device-security-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: In the confirmation dialog box, choose **Yes** to deploy the policy now, or choose **No** to create the policy without deploying it.
trans-unit.target: In the confirmation dialog box, choose **Yes** to deploy the policy now, or choose **No** to create the policy without deploying it.

trans-unit.source: You can view and edit the new policy by browsing through the sections for each policy type in the **Policy** workspace.
trans-unit.target: You can view and edit the new policy by browsing through the sections for each policy type in the **Policy** workspace.

trans-unit.source: When you create a policy that uses the recommended settings, the name of the new policy is a combination of the template name, date, and time.
trans-unit.target: When you create a policy that uses the recommended settings, the name of the new policy is a combination of the template name, date, and time.

trans-unit.source: When you edit the policy, the name is updated with the time and date of the edit.
trans-unit.target: When you edit the policy, the name is updated with the time and date of the edit.

trans-unit.source: After you create a policy, you will typically want to deploy it to one or more groups of users or devices.
trans-unit.target: After you create a policy, you will typically want to deploy it to one or more groups of users or devices.

trans-unit.source: You don't deploy all policy types.
trans-unit.target: You don't deploy all policy types.

trans-unit.source: For example, the mobile application management (MAM) policy is not deployed.
trans-unit.target: For example, the mobile application management (MAM) policy is not deployed.

trans-unit.source: This policy type is instead associated with an app, which you then deploy.
trans-unit.target: This policy type is instead associated with an app, which you then deploy.

trans-unit.source: Deploy a configuration policy
trans-unit.target: Deploy a configuration policy

trans-unit.source: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy that you want to deploy, and then choose **Manage Deployment**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy that you want to deploy, and then choose **Manage Deployment**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: To deploy the policy, select one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, and then choose **Add** > **OK**.
trans-unit.target: To deploy the policy, select one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, and then choose **Add** > **OK**.

trans-unit.source: To close the dialog box without deploying the policy, choose **Cancel**.
trans-unit.target: To close the dialog box without deploying the policy, choose **Cancel**.

trans-unit.source: When you select a deployed policy, you can view further information about the deployment in the lower part of the policies list.
trans-unit.target: When you select a deployed policy, you can view further information about the deployment in the lower part of the policies list.

trans-unit.source: Manage policies
trans-unit.target: Manage policies

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/), choose **Policy**, and then browse to and select the policy that you want to manage.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/), choose **Policy**, and then browse to and select the policy that you want to manage.

trans-unit.source: Select one of the following actions:
trans-unit.target: Select one of the following actions:

trans-unit.source: **Edit**: Open the properties for the selected policy so that you can make changes.
trans-unit.target: **Edit**: Open the properties for the selected policy so that you can make changes.

trans-unit.source: **Delete**: Delete the selected policy.
trans-unit.target: **Delete**: Delete the selected policy.

trans-unit.source: When you delete a policy, it is removed from all groups to which it was deployed.
trans-unit.target: When you delete a policy, it is removed from all groups to which it was deployed.

trans-unit.source: **Manage Deployment**: Select the group that you want to deploy the policy to, and then choose **Add**.
trans-unit.target: **Manage Deployment**: Select the group that you want to deploy the policy to, and then choose **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Frequently asked questions about Intune policies
trans-unit.target: Frequently asked questions about Intune policies

trans-unit.source: How long does it take for mobile devices to get a policy or apps after they have been deployed?
trans-unit.target: How long does it take for mobile devices to get a policy or apps after they have been deployed?

trans-unit.source: When a policy or an app is deployed, Intune immediately begins attempting to notify the device that it should check in with the Intune service.
trans-unit.target: When a policy or an app is deployed, Intune immediately begins attempting to notify the device that it should check in with the Intune service.

trans-unit.source: This typically takes less than five minutes.
trans-unit.target: This typically takes less than five minutes.

trans-unit.source: If a device doesn't check in to get the policy after the first notification is sent, Intune makes three more attempts.
trans-unit.target: If a device doesn't check in to get the policy after the first notification is sent, Intune makes three more attempts.

trans-unit.source: If the device is offline (for example, it is turned off or not connected to a network), it might not receive the notifications.
trans-unit.target: If the device is offline (for example, it is turned off or not connected to a network), it might not receive the notifications.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the device will get the policy on its next scheduled check-in with the Intune service as follows:
trans-unit.target: In this case, the device will get the policy on its next scheduled check-in with the Intune service as follows:

trans-unit.source: iOS and Mac OS X: Every 6 hours.
trans-unit.target: iOS and Mac OS X: Every 6 hours.

trans-unit.source: Android: Every 8 hours.
trans-unit.target: Android: Every 8 hours.

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone: Every 8 hours.
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone: Every 8 hours.

trans-unit.source: Enrolled Windows RT devices: Every 24 hours.
trans-unit.target: Enrolled Windows RT devices: Every 24 hours.

trans-unit.source: Windows 8.1 and Windows 10 PCs enrolled as devices: Every 8 hours.
trans-unit.target: Windows 8.1 and Windows 10 PCs enrolled as devices: Every 8 hours.

trans-unit.source: If the device has just enrolled, the check-in frequency will be more frequent, as follows:
trans-unit.target: If the device has just enrolled, the check-in frequency will be more frequent, as follows:

trans-unit.source: iOS and Mac OS X: Every 15 minutes for 6 hours, and then every 6 hours.
trans-unit.target: iOS and Mac OS X: Every 15 minutes for 6 hours, and then every 6 hours.

trans-unit.source: Android: Every 3 minutes for 15 minutes, then every 15 minutes for 2 hours, and then every 8 hours.
trans-unit.target: Android: Every 3 minutes for 15 minutes, then every 15 minutes for 2 hours, and then every 8 hours.

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone: Every 5 minutes for 15 minutes, then every 15 minutes for 2 hours, and then every 8 hours.
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone: Every 5 minutes for 15 minutes, then every 15 minutes for 2 hours, and then every 8 hours.

trans-unit.source: Windows PCs enrolled as devices: Every 3 minutes for 30 minutes, and then every 8 hours.
trans-unit.target: Windows PCs enrolled as devices: Every 3 minutes for 30 minutes, and then every 8 hours.

trans-unit.source: Users can also open the Company Portal app and sync the device to immediately check for the policy anytime.
trans-unit.target: Users can also open the Company Portal app and sync the device to immediately check for the policy anytime.

trans-unit.source: What actions cause Intune to immediately send a notification to a device?
trans-unit.target: What actions cause Intune to immediately send a notification to a device?

trans-unit.source: Devices check in with Intune either when they receive a notification that tells them to check in or during their regularly scheduled check-in.
trans-unit.target: Devices check in with Intune either when they receive a notification that tells them to check in or during their regularly scheduled check-in.

trans-unit.source: When you target a device or user specifically with an action such as a wipe, lock, passcode reset, app deployment, profile deployment (Wi-Fi, VPN, email, etc.), or policy deployment, Intune will immediately begin trying to notify the device that it should check in with the Intune service to receive these updates.
trans-unit.target: When you target a device or user specifically with an action such as a wipe, lock, passcode reset, app deployment, profile deployment (Wi-Fi, VPN, email, etc.), or policy deployment, Intune will immediately begin trying to notify the device that it should check in with the Intune service to receive these updates.

trans-unit.source: Other changes, such as revising the contact information in the company portal, do not cause an immediate notification to devices.
trans-unit.target: Other changes, such as revising the contact information in the company portal, do not cause an immediate notification to devices.

trans-unit.source: If multiple policies are deployed to the same user or device, how do I know which settings will get applied?
trans-unit.target: If multiple policies are deployed to the same user or device, how do I know which settings will get applied?

trans-unit.source: When two or more policies are deployed to the same user or device, the evaluation for which setting is applied happens at the individual setting level:
trans-unit.target: When two or more policies are deployed to the same user or device, the evaluation for which setting is applied happens at the individual setting level:

trans-unit.source: Compliance policy settings always have precedence over configuration policy settings.
trans-unit.target: Compliance policy settings always have precedence over configuration policy settings.

trans-unit.source: The most restrictive compliance policy setting is applied if it is evaluated against the same setting in a different compliance policy.
trans-unit.target: The most restrictive compliance policy setting is applied if it is evaluated against the same setting in a different compliance policy.

trans-unit.source: If a configuration policy setting conflicts with a setting in a different configuration policy, this conflict will be displayed in the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: If a configuration policy setting conflicts with a setting in a different configuration policy, this conflict will be displayed in the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: You must manually resolve such conflicts.
trans-unit.target: You must manually resolve such conflicts.

trans-unit.source: What happens when mobile application management policies conflict with each other?
trans-unit.target: What happens when mobile application management policies conflict with each other?

trans-unit.source: Which one will be applied to the app?
trans-unit.target: Which one will be applied to the app?

trans-unit.source: Conflict values are the most restrictive settings available in a MAM policy, except for the number entry fields (like PIN attempts before reset).
trans-unit.target: Conflict values are the most restrictive settings available in a MAM policy, except for the number entry fields (like PIN attempts before reset).

trans-unit.source: The number entry fields will be set the same as the values, as if you created a MAM policy in the console by using the recommended settings option.
trans-unit.target: The number entry fields will be set the same as the values, as if you created a MAM policy in the console by using the recommended settings option.

trans-unit.source: Conflicts occur when two policy settings are the same.
trans-unit.target: Conflicts occur when two policy settings are the same.

trans-unit.source: For example, you configured two MAM policies that are identical except for the copy/paste setting.
trans-unit.target: For example, you configured two MAM policies that are identical except for the copy/paste setting.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, the copy/paste setting will be set to the most restrictive value, but the rest of the settings will be applied as configured.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, the copy/paste setting will be set to the most restrictive value, but the rest of the settings will be applied as configured.

trans-unit.source: If one policy is deployed to the app and takes effect, and then a second one is deployed, the first one will take precedence and stay applied, while the second shows in conflict.
trans-unit.target: If one policy is deployed to the app and takes effect, and then a second one is deployed, the first one will take precedence and stay applied, while the second shows in conflict.

trans-unit.source: If they are both applied at the same time, meaning that there is no preceding policy, then they will both be in conflict.
trans-unit.target: If they are both applied at the same time, meaning that there is no preceding policy, then they will both be in conflict.

trans-unit.source: Any conflicting settings will be set to the most restrictive values.
trans-unit.target: Any conflicting settings will be set to the most restrictive values.

trans-unit.source: What happens when iOS custom policies conflict?
trans-unit.target: What happens when iOS custom policies conflict?

trans-unit.source: Intune does not evaluate the payload of Apple Configuration files or a custom Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier (OMA-URI) policy.
trans-unit.target: Intune does not evaluate the payload of Apple Configuration files or a custom Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier (OMA-URI) policy.

trans-unit.source: It merely serves as the delivery mechanism.
trans-unit.target: It merely serves as the delivery mechanism.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy a custom policy, ensure that the configured settings do not conflict with compliance, configuration, or other custom policies.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy a custom policy, ensure that the configured settings do not conflict with compliance, configuration, or other custom policies.

trans-unit.source: In the case of a custom policy with settings conflicts, the order in which settings are applied is random.
trans-unit.target: In the case of a custom policy with settings conflicts, the order in which settings are applied is random.

trans-unit.source: What happens when a policy is deleted or no longer applicable?
trans-unit.target: What happens when a policy is deleted or no longer applicable?

trans-unit.source: When you delete a policy, or you remove a device from a group to which a policy was deployed, the policy and settings will be removed from the device according to the following lists.
trans-unit.target: When you delete a policy, or you remove a device from a group to which a policy was deployed, the policy and settings will be removed from the device according to the following lists.

trans-unit.source: Enrolled devices
trans-unit.target: Enrolled devices

trans-unit.source: Wi-Fi, VPN, certificate, and email profiles: These profiles are removed from all supported enrolled devices.
trans-unit.target: Wi-Fi, VPN, certificate, and email profiles: These profiles are removed from all supported enrolled devices.

trans-unit.source: All other policy types:
trans-unit.target: All other policy types:

trans-unit.source: **Windows and Android devices**: Settings are not removed from the device.
trans-unit.target: **Windows and Android devices**: Settings are not removed from the device.

trans-unit.source: **Windows Phone 8.1 devices**: The following settings are removed:
trans-unit.target: **Windows Phone 8.1 devices**: The following settings are removed:

trans-unit.source: Require a password to unlock mobile devices
trans-unit.target: Require a password to unlock mobile devices

trans-unit.source: Allow simple passwords
trans-unit.target: Allow simple passwords

trans-unit.source: Minimum password length
trans-unit.target: Minimum password length

trans-unit.source: Required password type
trans-unit.target: Required password type

trans-unit.source: Password expiration (days)
trans-unit.target: Password expiration (days)

trans-unit.source: Remember password history
trans-unit.target: Remember password history

trans-unit.source: Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped
trans-unit.target: Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped

trans-unit.source: Minutes of inactivity before password is required
trans-unit.target: Minutes of inactivity before password is required

trans-unit.source: Required password type – minimum number of character sets
trans-unit.target: Required password type – minimum number of character sets

trans-unit.source: Allow camera
trans-unit.target: Allow camera

trans-unit.source: Require encryption on mobile device
trans-unit.target: Require encryption on mobile device

trans-unit.source: Allow removable storage
trans-unit.target: Allow removable storage

trans-unit.source: Allow web browser
trans-unit.target: Allow web browser

trans-unit.source: Allow application store
trans-unit.target: Allow application store

trans-unit.source: Allow screen capture
trans-unit.target: Allow screen capture

trans-unit.source: Allow geolocation
trans-unit.target: Allow geolocation

trans-unit.source: Allow Microsoft account
trans-unit.target: Allow Microsoft account

trans-unit.source: Allow copy and paste
trans-unit.target: Allow copy and paste

trans-unit.source: Allow Wi-Fi tethering
trans-unit.target: Allow Wi-Fi tethering

trans-unit.source: Allow automatic connection to free Wi-Fi hotspots
trans-unit.target: Allow automatic connection to free Wi-Fi hotspots

trans-unit.source: Allow Wi-Fi hotspot reporting
trans-unit.target: Allow Wi-Fi hotspot reporting

trans-unit.source: Allow factory reset
trans-unit.target: Allow factory reset

trans-unit.source: Allow Bluetooth
trans-unit.target: Allow Bluetooth

trans-unit.source: Allow NFC
trans-unit.target: Allow NFC

trans-unit.source: Allow Wi-Fi
trans-unit.target: Allow Wi-Fi

trans-unit.source: **iOS**: All settings are removed, except:
trans-unit.target: **iOS**: All settings are removed, except:

trans-unit.source: Allow voice roaming
trans-unit.target: Allow voice roaming

trans-unit.source: Allow data roaming
trans-unit.target: Allow data roaming

trans-unit.source: Allow automatic synchronization while roaming
trans-unit.target: Allow automatic synchronization while roaming

trans-unit.source: Windows PCs running the Intune client software
trans-unit.target: Windows PCs running the Intune client software

trans-unit.source: **Endpoint Protection settings**: Settings are restored to their recommended values.
trans-unit.target: **Endpoint Protection settings**: Settings are restored to their recommended values.

trans-unit.source: The only exception is the **Join Microsoft Active Protection Service** setting, for which the default value is **No**.
trans-unit.target: The only exception is the **Join Microsoft Active Protection Service** setting, for which the default value is **No**.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune](help-secure-windows-pcs-with-endpoint-protection-for-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune](help-secure-windows-pcs-with-endpoint-protection-for-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: **Software updates settings**: Settings are reset to the default state for the operating system.
trans-unit.target: **Software updates settings**: Settings are reset to the default state for the operating system.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune](keep-windows-pcs-up-to-date-with-software-updates-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune](keep-windows-pcs-up-to-date-with-software-updates-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: **Microsoft Intune Center settings**: Any support contact information that was configured by the policy is deleted from computers.
trans-unit.target: **Microsoft Intune Center settings**: Any support contact information that was configured by the policy is deleted from computers.

trans-unit.source: **Windows Firewall settings**: Settings are reset to the default for the computer operating system.
trans-unit.target: **Windows Firewall settings**: Settings are reset to the default for the computer operating system.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune](help-secure-windows-pcs-with-endpoint-protection-for-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune](help-secure-windows-pcs-with-endpoint-protection-for-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: How can I refresh the policies on a device to ensure that they are current (applies to Windows PCs running the Intune client software only)?
trans-unit.target: How can I refresh the policies on a device to ensure that they are current (applies to Windows PCs running the Intune client software only)?

trans-unit.source: In any device group, select the devices on which you want to refresh the policies, and then choose **Remote Tasks** > **Refresh Policies**.
trans-unit.target: In any device group, select the devices on which you want to refresh the policies, and then choose **Remote Tasks** > **Refresh Policies**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Remote Tasks** in the lower-right corner of the Intune administration console to check the task status.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Remote Tasks** in the lower-right corner of the Intune administration console to check the task status.

trans-unit.source: Where can I find help troubleshooting policies?
trans-unit.target: Where can I find help troubleshooting policies?

trans-unit.source: See [Troubleshoot policies in Microsoft Intune](/intune/troubleshoot/troubleshoot-policies-in-microsoft-intune).
trans-unit.target: See [Troubleshoot policies in Microsoft Intune](/intune/troubleshoot/troubleshoot-policies-in-microsoft-intune).
